Line 21: Line 21:
'''cPanel''' ('''c'''ontrol '''Panel''') is a graphical [[web-based]] [[Control panel (Web hosting)|web-hosting control panel]], designed to simplify administration of [[website]]s. cPanel handles aspects of website administration in its interface. The [[software]], which is [[proprietary software|proprietary]] and distributed by cPanel, Inc., is designed for use by commercial [[web hosting]] services, so the company does not offer a reduced-cost personal use license; however, owners of non-profit organizations such as educational institutions and charities can request a license at a free or reduced cost. Reduced prices are frequently available from dedicated-server companies, who install it along with the operating system.
'''cPanel''' ('''c'''ontrol '''Panel''') is a graphical [[web-based]] [[Control panel (Web hosting)|web-hosting control panel]], designed to simplify administration of [[website]]s. cPanel handles aspects of website administration in its interface. The [[software]], which is [[proprietary software|proprietary]] and distributed by cPanel, Inc., is designed for use by commercial [[web hosting]] services, so the company does not offer a reduced-cost personal use license; however, owners of non-profit organizations such as educational institutions and charities can request a license at a free or reduced cost. Reduced prices are frequently available from dedicated-server companies, who install it along with the operating system.
â
cPanel runs on [[RPM Package Manager|RPM]]-based [[Linux]] [[Linux distribution|distributions]] including [[SUSE Linux|SUSE]], [[Fedora Core|Fedora]], [[Mandriva Linux|Mandriva]], [[CentOS]], [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]] as well as [[FreeBSD]]. The company claims preliminary support for [[Debian]], although this version has been in "beta" state for several years and is not supported. cPanel is commonly accessed on [[TCP and UDP port|ports]] 2082 and 2083 (for an [[Secure Sockets Layer|SSL]] version). Authentication is either via [[HTTP]] or web page login.
+
cPanel runs on [[RPM Package Manager|RPM]]-based [[Linux]] [[Linux distribution|distributions]] including [[SUSE Linux|SUSE]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], [[Mandriva Linux|Mandriva]], [[CentOS]], [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]] as well as [[FreeBSD]]. The company claims preliminary support for [[Debian]], although this version has been in "beta" state for several years and is not supported. cPanel is commonly accessed on [[TCP and UDP port|ports]] 2082 and 2083 (for an [[Secure Sockets Layer|SSL]] version). Authentication is either via [[HTTP]] or web page login.
